description.narrative:
Gender Action Learning System (GALS) is a methodology for community-led empowerment. It aims to support both women and men to have more control over their lives, as well as to catalyse a sustainable movement for gender justice. GALS was introduced in Vietnam since 2014 and applied in the chicken, pork and shrimp value chains from mid - 2015, aiming to promote gender equality and economic development for smallholder farmers involved in these value chains.
Since early 2017, under The Gender Transformative <(>&<)> Responsible Business Investment in South East Asia project (GRAISEA), Oxfam in Vietnam has cooperated with private sector to pilot inclusive business models in rice value chains. The project supports rice farmers in Soc Trang and An Giang provinces to improve their production practices in compliance with Sustainable Rice Production (SRP) principles. The objective of the cooperation model is to realizeimproved livelihoods for women and men small-scale rice producers in Vietnam through more responsible and inclusive value chains development where women demonstrate economic leadership. Result from the multi-stakeholders workshop in the rice value chain by end ofNovember 2017 has pointed out lot of potential for Gender mainstreaming and GALS application: good will from Gentraco # the company, clear linkage of gender/social issues and some bottle necks for the smooth cooperation among the famers # the company # technical service providers: lack of shared decision making at household vs the complianceof SRP requirements; limited mutual trust among stakeholders and challenges in strengthening collective action in the farmer groups. It is essential to consolidate the farmer groups using GALS methodology to ensure meeting expected results of the projectphase I and lay solid foundation for the GRAISEA II is in designing process. This proposal covers the duration between Jan-March 2018 with activities using GALS methodology to strengthen gender mainstreaming and collective action in selected rice producer groups contributing to enhanced cooperation among the famer # the company # technical service providers in An Giang and Soc Trang provinces in accompanying with current interventions of GRAISEA project. These groups will be models for other groups to replicate in phase II.
CECEM is a local partner of Oxfam in Vietnam. One of shared objectives between CECEM and Oxfam is to promote for the voice of marginalized and vulnerable people. In the project, CECEM willwork with local partners of rice value chain in Soc Trang and AnGiang province to build sense of collective action and gender equality/ women's economic empowerment of rice producers women and men in the project area through rice value chain engagement. CECEM will apply Gender Action Learning System - a community - led empowerment methodology which is developed by Oxfam to facilitate for a process of self- analysis and action for change of those women and men.

participating-org.narrative: CECEM Training & Consulting JSC CECEM T&C

CECEM CECEM (Center for Community Empowerment) is a service organization in Vietnam, adding values to development programmes through providing professional training, consultancies and implementing projects in the fields of adult learning, participatoryproject management, organisation development , and small and medium enterprises development. CECEM partners with INGOs, Vietnamese NGOs, bilateral and multilateral projects, development projects funded by the embassies, public organisations, and small andmedium enterprises in the rural area. CECEM shares common value and vision with Oxfam Novib in term of community empowerment, where the community capacity are built and local potentialities are explored to help them to realize their own problem, causes and how to overcome their challenge by implementing their own action. Oxfam Novib and CECEM see big potentiality to collaborate with each other to promote WEMAN in development projects in Viet Nam.
